Interface HangmanManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Hangman

    public interface HangmanManager
    A HangmanManager keeps track of the state of a game of hangman. Methods provide access to the current set of guesses, number of wrong guesses remaining, and the current pattern to be displayed to the user. The record method updates state by recording a new guess and updating the other values appropriately.

    Implementing classes must include a constructor of the following form: 

     public HangmanManager(final List dictionary,
                       final int length,
                       final int max)
    This constructs a HangmanManager by first determining the initial set of words with the specified length from the dictionary then selecting the goal.
    • The dictionary parameter is a list of candidate goal words.
    • The length parameter is the length of acceptable candidate goal words.
    • The max parameter is the maximum number of wrong guesses permitted.
    • The constructor throws and IllegalArgumentException if length < 1. or if max < 0.

    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Dr. Jody Paul

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SortedSet<Character> guesses()
      Accesses the set of letters already guessed by the user.
      int guessesLeft()
      Accesses the number of allowable wrong guesses.
      String pattern()
      Return the hangman-style display pattern of letters and dashes appropriate to the current state based on the letters already guessed and the goal.
      int record(char guess)
      Record state changes based on new letter guess.
      Set<String> words()
      Accesses the set of candidate goal words.

    • Method Detail

      • words

        Set<String> words()
        Accesses the set of candidate goal words.
        Returns:
        the set of candidate goal words

      • guessesLeft

        int guessesLeft()
        Accesses the number of allowable wrong guesses.
        Returns:
        the number of wrong guesses the user has left

      • guesses

        SortedSet<Character> guesses()
        Accesses the set of letters already guessed by the user.
        Returns:
        the current set of letters guessed by the user

      • pattern

        String pattern()
        Return the hangman-style display pattern of letters and dashes appropriate to the current state based on the letters already guessed and the goal.
        Returns:
        the hangman-style pattern to be displayed to the user
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if there is no goal word

      • record

        int record(char guess)
        Record state changes based on new letter guess.
        Parameters:
        guess - the letter being guessed [Precondition: must be lower-case letter] [Precondition: must not be among letters already guessed]
        Returns:
        the number of occurrences of the guessed letter in the goal
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no guesses left or no goal word
        IllegalArgumentException - if letter is already guessed
